metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3513 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in d1_srtp.c in the DTLS SRTP extension in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1j allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted handshake message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7').
